serverSide
Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      serverSide.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ClientHandler
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable

This is the ClientHandler class. There should be a ClientHandler for every Client connected to the server. Every ClientHandler is a thread on the Server side to handle all the writing and reading on the Object Streams to and from the Client. The ClientHandler is observed by the ServerFrame.

Version:
2018-03-05
Author:
Lars Andersson

Constructor Detail

ClientHandler

public ClientHandler(java.net.Socket socket,
                     ClientHandler[] user,
                     int pid,
                     HighscoreHandler scorehandler,
                     serverSide.PacketHandler packetHandler,
                     java.util.Observer serverFrame)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Creates the ClientHandler.

Parameters:
socket - The socket it should listen on.
user - A ClientHandler array containing all the ClientHandlers.
pid - The PlayerID the Client should have.
scorehandler - A reference to the HighscoreHandler.
packetHandler - A reference to the PacketHandler.
serverFrame - The observer.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Throws an exception if something went wrong creating the ClientHandler.

getObjectOutputStream

Getter for the ObjectOutputStream.

Returns:
Returns the ObjectOutputStream.

isReady

public boolean isReady()
Tells the caller if the ClientHandler is ready.

Returns:
Returns a boolean representing the ready-status of the ClientHandler.

initializeClient

public void initializeClient()
Tells the Client who it is, sending out a PlayerInitializationPacket with the playerID. After that it waits for 32ms and sets the ready boolean to true.

getSocket

public java.net.Socket getSocket()
Getter for the socket.

Returns:
Returns the Socket.

getId

public int getId()
Getter for the playerID.

Returns:
Returns an int representing the playerID.

getConnectedUsers

public java.lang.String getConnectedUsers()
Shows how many clients are connected to the server, and some information about them.

Returns:
Returns a String containing information about every Client connected to the Server.
